paragraph.paragraph: Compiling is the process of building a project into an executable file which may be then executed externally to ENViSioN!. To compile a project, select BuildSolution fromthe Build menu as demonstrated below:
There are six entries on the Build menu, each described below:

list.item: Build Solution - Compiles the current solution. All projects in the current solution will be built. This process attempts to minimize the compilationthat must beundertaken, by only re-compiling files that have been modified.

Rebuild Solution - Compiles the current solution from scratch. All projects in the current solution will be built. There is no optimization of whichfiles will be compiled,and it is equivalent to compiling a project for the very first time.

Build Selection - Compiles only the currently selected project in the
0 !DefaultAssociativeIndex Eiffel Solution Explorer>Solution Explorer . The compilation method of this project is equivalent to that performedby BuildSolution. This menu entry is grayed out when there is no project selected in the
0 !DefaultAssociativeIndex Eiffel Solution Explorer>Solution Explorer .

Rebuild Selection - Compiles only the currently selected project in the
0 !DefaultAssociativeIndex Eiffel Solution Explorer>Solution Explorer .The compilation method of this project is equivalent to that performedby RebuildSolution. This menu entry is grayed out when there is no project selected in the
0 !DefaultAssociativeIndex Eiffel Solution Explorer>Solution Explorer .
Batch Build... - Displays a dialog allowing you to specify which Projects are to be compiled. This allows you to compile selected projects withinthe currentSolution.
Configuration Manager... - Displays a dialog allowing you to specify Project configuration information for each Project in the Solution.

paragraph.paragraph:
The
0 !DefaultAssociativeIndex Eiffel Property Pages>Project Property Pages allow you to adjust the properties of your project, many of which applydirectly to thecompilation.

If your compilation fails, see
0 !DefaultAssociativeIndex Eiffel Compilation Error>Compilation Errors for more information on correcting such errors.
paragraph.heading: 2Resources
paragraph.paragraph: To include the contents of a resource file into your Project, a resource file matching the name of the system must be placed in both the "debug" and "release"directories. Duringcompilation, the contents of these files will be included in the unmanaged .dll.
